content: Yes, you can go to therapy for just one session, although it is not a common practice. Typically, therapy takes time and multiple sessions are necessary to develop a trusting relationship with a therapist and achieve the desired outcomes. Generally, the length and frequency of therapy sessions will depend on your specific issues, goals, and your therapist's treatment approach. Some therapists may offer brief, focused therapies that may take only a few sessions, while others may recommend longer-term therapy that lasts for several months or even years. It's important to discuss your expectations and concerns with your therapist and work together to come up with a plan that works for you.
